<p dir="auto"><em>This package defines dice and operations with them.</em></p>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/2eb988459cf9a295801e551962eb5c480fbe784af97d08920859200e9398c974/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f6769746875622f6c6963656e73652f6162656c73697175656972612f44696365526f6c6c732e6a6c3f7374796c653d666c61742d737175617265"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/2eb988459cf9a295801e551962eb5c480fbe784af97d08920859200e9398c974/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f6769746875622f6c6963656e73652f6162656c73697175656972612f44696365526f6c6c732e6a6c3f7374796c653d666c61742d737175617265" alt="MPL-2.0 License" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/github/license/abelsiqueira/DiceRolls.jl?style=flat-square" style="max-width: 100%;"></a>

<hr>
<p dir="auto">This package defines dice and some operations with them. We recommend looking into the docs for a better description of what you can do. As a simple example, here is the distribution of the tradicional ability score roll on Dungeons and Dragons, i.e., rolling 4 six-sided dice, removing the lowest and summing the result.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="v, f = DiceRolls.histogram(drop(4d6), normalize=true)
Plots.bar(v, f, size=(400,300), leg=false)
xticks!(v)"><pre>v, f <span class="pl-k">=</span> DiceRolls<span class="pl-k">.</span><span class="pl-c1">histogram</span>(<span class="pl-c1">drop</span>(<span class="pl-c1">4</span>d6), normalize<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">true</span>)
Plots<span class="pl-k">.</span><span class="pl-c1">bar</span>(v, f, size<span class="pl-k">=</span>(<span class="pl-c1">400</span>,<span class="pl-c1">300</span>), leg<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">false</span>)
<span class="pl-c1">xticks!</span>(v)</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="examples/4d6D1.png"><img src="examples/4d6D1.png" alt="" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<p dir="auto">Another example is to roll two four-sided dice, subtract 1 from each, and multiply the result.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="v, f = DiceRolls.histogram((1d4 - 1) * (1d4 - 1))
Plots.bar(v, f, size=(400,300), leg=false)
xticks!(v)"><pre>v, f <span class="pl-k">=</span> DiceRolls<span class="pl-k">.</span><span class="pl-c1">histogram</span>((<span class="pl-c1">1</span>d4 <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">*</span> (<span class="pl-c1">1</span>d4 <span class="pl-k">-</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>))
Plots<span class="pl-k">.</span><span class="pl-c1">bar</span>(v, f, size<span class="pl-k">=</span>(<span class="pl-c1">400</span>,<span class="pl-c1">300</span>), leg<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">false</span>)
<span class="pl-c1">xticks!</span>(v)</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="examples/complex.png"><img src="examples/complex.png" alt="" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<p dir="auto">This example can be found in the <a href="examples">examples</a> folder.</p>
</article></div>
